Items.question: Cheap Consumable items that give health regen on use, assuming, there is nearby tree to devour...Somehow.
Item that is frequently bought by the tankiest hero on the team when the enemy has a surplus of magic damage.
This item will save you from a legion commander duel before it even happens
The bane of supports, who just want to survive a fight for longer than 5 seconds with some of the meager items they have managed to collect.
This item provides a permanent regenerating barrier, without taking an item slot once active.

Heroes.question: This hero is the most popular hero, presiding over the Fields of Endless Carnage as the resident Butcher.
This hero is the muscle of the Tyler Estate, while Silencer acts as its brains.
This hero is the oldest and most mysterious of the Spirit Brothers.
This feline fellow has the ability to take on entire armies man-to-man with only himself.
This hero represents the electromagnetic force of the universe and as a result can blend in both our universe and the DOTA universe.

Map Knowledge.question: This place, on 2 corners of the map, is a great way to help secure a win.
Every 2 minutes, a powerful object appears in one of these spaces for anyone to grab.
These structures allow for vision in frequently traveled places on the map
This section of the jungle boosts all heroes mana regen within in the area.
This object in the jungle provides a boon to reduce damage while under its gaze.

Hero Abilities.question: The ability to stop time momentarily, to both your teams boon and bane.
This ability, while one of many, allows one to quickly move from location to location instantaneously and belongs to more than one hero.
This ability has won 6 million dollars. It is known by a hero with fur and a deep connection with one of the 4 elements from Avatar.
This ability can be used on both allies and enemies. It lasts quite long but gives its target a moment of invincibility at the beginning.
This hero and ability, share a name with each other.

Jungle Creeps.question: This camp has the creep that are most difficult to kill, but are worth the most resources.
This camp, which has a medium and a large variant, has a creep with the ability to stun all those around it inside it.
This mechanic adds gold that is in the jungle at anyone one time. It is a great way to create extra gold for your team, regardless of what position you are playing.
This technique allows a small camp to assuredly deny friendly creeps on its own without having to be stacked first.
This jungle creep has the ability to stun all those around it.
